oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-04-12 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 12, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), guest performer Don Gibson (his first appearance as a regular member), and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl (chosen as the Grand Ole Opry's favorite comedian by TV & Radio Mirror's annual awards poll), and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 966th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Jordanaires; Don Gibson; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- Caribbean (Hank Snow) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces the Jordanaires -- Little Miss Ruby (Jordanaires) -- Hank Snow introduces Don Gibson -- Oh Lonesome Me (Don Gibson, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) Hank Snow introduces Tommy Jackson -- Old Joe Clark (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Hank Snow talks -- (The Angels Are Lighting) God's Little Candles (Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Chet Atkins -- Twelfth Street Rag (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Snow, Hank; Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003
